analysisVariables.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject record within the analysis dataset. As long as values are unique within a dataset, any valid number can be used for ASEQ. The use of this variable will be addressed in detail in the next version of ADaM IG.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Sequence Number
analysisVariables.name: ASEQ

analysisVariables.description: TRTP is a record-level identifier that represents the planned treatment attributed to a record for analysis purposes.
analysisVariables.label: Planned Treatment
analysisVariables.name: TRTP

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The numeric code for TRTP. One-to-one map to TRTP.
analysisVariables.label: Planned Treatment (N)
analysisVariables.name: TRTPN

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: TRTA is a record-level identifier that represents the actual treatment attributed to a record for analysis purposes.
analysisVariables.label: Actual Treatment
analysisVariables.name: TRTA

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The numeric code for TRTA. One-to-one map to TRTA.
analysisVariables.label: Actual Treatment (N)
analysisVariables.name: TRTAN

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: Subject-level identifier that represents the planned treatment for period xx. Must be identical to the ADSL variable. The letter 'xx' in the variable name refer to a specific period where 'xx' is replaced with a zero-padded two-digit integer (i.e., 01 - 99).
analysisVariables.label: Planned Treatment for Period xx
analysisVariables.name: TRTxxP

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The numeric code variable for TRTxxP. One-to-one map to TRTxxP. If included in ADSL, must be identical to the ADSL variable.
analysisVariables.label: Planned Treatment for Period xx (N)
analysisVariables.name: TRTxxPN

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: Subject-level identifier that represents the actual treatment for period xx. If included in ADSL, must be identical to the ADSL variable.
analysisVariables.label: Actual Treatment for Period xx
analysisVariables.name: TRTxxA

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The numeric code variable for TRTxxA. One-to-one map to TRTxxA. If included in ADSL, must be identical to the ADSL variable.
analysisVariables.label: Actual Treatment for Period xx (N)
analysisVariables.name: TRTxxAN

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The description of the analysis parameter. Examples include: 'Time to Death (days)', 'Time to First Hospitalization Through Day 168 (days)', 'Time to Progression Free Survival (days)', and 'Time to Hepatitis B Seroconversion (days)'. PARAM should be sufficient to describe clear contents of AVAL, including the unit of the measurement, if applicable. PARAM may be longer than 40 characters in length (200-character limit).
analysisVariables.label: Parameter
analysisVariables.name: PARAM

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The short name of the analysis parameter in PARAM. Values of PARAMCD should follow SAS 5 variable naming conventions (8 characters or less; starts with letter; contains only letters and digits). There must be a one-to-one mapping with PARAM. Examples include DEATH, PFS, and T2SERO.
analysisVariables.label: Parameter Code
analysisVariables.name: PARAMCD

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: AVAL is the elapsed time to the event of interest from the origin. For example, if AVAL is measured in days, AVAL would be ADT - STARTDT or ADT - STARTDT + 1
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Value
analysisVariables.name: AVAL

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

self.title: Time to Event Origin Date for Subject

analysisVariables.description: The original date of risk for the time-to-event analysis. This is generally the time at which a subject is first at risk for the event of interest evaluation (as defined in the Protocol or Statistical Analysis Plan). For example, this may be the randomization date or the date of first study therapy exposure.
analysisVariables.label: Time to Event Origin Date for Subject
analysisVariables.name: STARTDT

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The date/time associated with STARTDT in numeric format.
analysisVariables.label: Time to Event Origin Date/Time
analysisVariables.name: STARTDTM

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C81223

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The level of imputation of the origin date. See General Timing Variable Convention #6 in the ADaM IG [2].
analysisVariables.label: Origin Date Imputation Flag
analysisVariables.name: STARTDTF

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C81226

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The level of imputation of the origin time. See General Timing Variable Convention #7 in the ADaM IG [2].
analysisVariables.label: Origin Time Imputation Flag
analysisVariables.name: STARTTMF

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: CNSR is a required variable for a time-to-event analysis dataset, though it is a conditionally required variable with respect to the ADaM BDS. For example, CNSR = 0 for event and CNSR > 0 for censored records.
analysisVariables.label: Censor
analysisVariables.name: CNSR

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: Describe the event of interest or an event that warrants censoring. Values for EVNTDESC will be defined in the metadata as sponsor-defined controlled terminology (See Section 7.1).
analysisVariables.label: Event or Censoring Description
analysisVariables.name: EVNTDESC

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: Describe the circumstance represented by the censoring date if different from the event date that warrants censoring.
analysisVariables.label: Censor Date Description
analysisVariables.name: CNSDTDSC

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: Analysis date of event or censoring associated with AVAL in numeric format.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Date
analysisVariables.name: ADT

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: Analysis date/time of event or censoring associated with AVAL in numeric format.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Date/Time
analysisVariables.name: ADTM

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C81223

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The level of imputation of ADT based on the source SDTM DTC variable. See General Timing Variable Convention #6 in the ADaM IG [2].
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Date Imputation Flag
analysisVariables.name: ADTF

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C81226

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The level of imputation of ATM based on the source SDTM DTC variable. See General Timing Variable Convention #7 in the ADaM IG [2].
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Time Imputation Flag
analysisVariables.name: ATMF

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: Analysis visit where event or censoring occurred. AVISIT may contain the visit names as observed (i.e., from SDTM VISIT), derived visit names, or conceptual description (e.g., endpoint).
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Visit
analysisVariables.name: AVISIT

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The name of the SDTM domain (or dataset) or analysis dataset that relates to the analysis variable (e.g., AVAL). Allowing SRCDOM to be not only SDTM, but also ADaM dataset will be addressed in the next version of ADaM IG.
analysisVariables.label: Source Data
analysisVariables.name: SRCDOM

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The name of the column (in the domain or dataset identified by SRCDOM) that relates to the analysis variable. In the event that SRCDOM is a SUPPQUAL domain, then SRCVAR will be populated with the value of QNAM.
analysisVariables.label: Source Variable
analysisVariables.name: SRCVAR

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses

parentProduct.title: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The sequence number --SEQ or ASEQ of the row (in the domain or dataset identified by SRCDOM) that relates to the analysis variable.
analysisVariables.label: Source Sequence Number
analysisVariables.name: SRCSEQ

dataStructures.description: One record per subject per parameter
dataStructures.label: Basic Data Structure for Time to Event Analyses
dataStructures.name: BDS for TTE

description: The purpose of this document is to present the ADaM Basic Data Structure (BDS) for time-to-event (TTE) analyses. The TTE analyses can be applied to a broad range of clinical outcomes. The event might be single, composite, recurrent, or one of multiple potential events.
label: ADaM Basic Data Structure for Time-to-Event Analyses Version 1.0
name: ADaM BDS for TTE v1.0
source: Prepared by the CDISC Analysis Data Model (ADaM) Team
